Consider a linear algebra framework analyzing the effect of matrix diagonalization on eigenvalues and eigenvectors. The system examines the matrix transformation \\( P^{-1}AP \\), where A is an initial matrix and P is the matrix formed by the eigenvectors of A.

If after transforming A to D an external matrix Q modifies D to form \\( Q^{-1}DQ \\), will the resultant matrix have the same eigenvalues as the initial matrix A?
Question Type: from cause to effect with intervention
Explanation: Matrix transformations such as Q that simply change the basis (assuming Q is invertible and modifies the basis correctly) do not affect the eigenvalues. Therefore, despite the intervention, the eigenvalues of the resultant matrix will remain unchanged from those of A.
